content:
ProcessHost Class

In this Article

Represents a process host.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class ProcessHost : MarshalByRefObject, System.Web.Hosting.IAdphManager, System.Web.Hosting.IApplicationPreloadManager, System.Web.Hosting.IPphManager, System.Web.Hosting.IProcessHost, System.Web.Hosting.IProcessHostIdleAndHealthCheck

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.MarshalByRefObject
  • ProcessHost

Inherited Members

,

,

,

,
ToString()

Remarks

ProcessHost is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

Methods summary

EnumerateAppDomains(IAppDomainInfoEnum)

Provides access to an enumerable set of application domains.
InitializeLifetimeService()

Gives the process host an infinite lifetime by preventing a lease from being created.
IsIdle()

Gets the state of a process.
Ping(IProcessPingCallback)

Pings a process.
SetApplicationPreloadState(String,String,Boolean)

Notifies ASP.NET that a particular application that is running on IIS 7.0 is configured to be preloaded.
SetApplicationPreloadUtil(IApplicationPreloadUtil)

Creates a type that calls IIS 7.0 to get information that is required in order to preload an application.
Shutdown()

Unloads the process host.
ShutdownApplication(String)

Shuts down the specified application.
StartAppDomainProtocolListenerChannel(String,String,IListenerChannelCallback)

Starts an application domain protocol listener channel.
StartApplication(String,String,Object)

Starts the specified application.
StartProcessProtocolListenerChannel(String,IListenerChannelCallback)

Starts a process protocol listener channel.
StopAppDomainProtocol(String,String,Boolean)

Stops an application domain protocol listener channel.
StopAppDomainProtocolListenerChannel(String,String,Int32,Boolean)

Stops an application domain protocol listener channel.
StopProcessProtocol(String,Boolean)

Stops a process protocol.
StopProcessProtocolListenerChannel(String,Int32,Boolean)

Stops a protocol listener channel.

Methods

  • EnumerateAppDomains(IAppDomainInfoEnum)

    Provides access to an enumerable set of application domains.

    public void EnumerateAppDomains (out System.Web.Hosting.IAppDomainInfoEnum appDomainInfoEnum);

    Parameters

    • appDomainInfoEnum
      IAppDomainInfoEnum

      Information about the application domains.

  • InitializeLifetimeService()

    Gives the process host an infinite lifetime by preventing a lease from being created.

    public override object InitializeLifetimeService ();

    Returns

    • Object

      Returns a null value to indicate that the lease never expires.

    Remarks

    InitializeLifetimeService is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

  • IsIdle()

    Gets the state of a process.

    public bool IsIdle ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the process host is idle; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    IsIdle is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

  • Ping(IProcessPingCallback)

    Pings a process.

    public void Ping (System.Web.Hosting.IProcessPingCallback callback);

    Parameters

    • callback
      IProcessPingCallback

      The callback to handle the ping response.

    Remarks

    Ping is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

  • SetApplicationPreloadState(String,String,Boolean)

    Notifies ASP.NET that a particular application that is running on IIS 7.0 is configured to be preloaded.

    public void SetApplicationPreloadState (string context, string appId, bool enabled);

    Parameters

    • context
      String

      The application context.

    • appId
      String

      The unique ID of the application.

    • enabled
      Boolean

      true to indicate the application should be preloaded; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      enabled is set to true and the process host was not previously passed an IApplicationPreloadUtil interface to its stem.Web.Hosting.IApplicationPreloadManager.SetApplicationPreloadUtil* method

    Remarks

    This method implements the SetApplicationPreloadState method of the IApplicationPreloadManager interface. IIS 7.0 calls the SetApplicationPreloadState method to notify ASP.NET whether the application that is being loaded supports preloading.

    Note

    This method applies only to applications that run on IIS 7.0.

  • SetApplicationPreloadUtil(IApplicationPreloadUtil)

    Creates a type that calls IIS 7.0 to get information that is required in order to preload an application.

    public void SetApplicationPreloadUtil (System.Web.Hosting.IApplicationPreloadUtil applicationPreloadUtil);

    Parameters

    • applicationPreloadUtil
      IApplicationPreloadUtil

      The handle to an unmanaged interface in IIS 7.0 that ASP.NET calls to get information.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The IApplicationPreloadUtil instance that contains information for preloading the application is not null.

    Remarks

    This method implements the SetApplicationPreloadUtil method of the IApplicationPreloadManager interface. The method creates an instance of the IApplicationPreloadUtil type, which calls into IIS 7.0 to get preloading information.

    Note

    This method applies only to applications that run on IIS 7.0.

  • Shutdown()

    Unloads the process host.

    public void Shutdown ();
  • ShutdownApplication(String)

    Shuts down the specified application.

    public void ShutdownApplication (string appId);

    Parameters

    • appId
      String

      The unique identifier of the application to shut down.

    Remarks

    ShutdownApplication is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

  • StartAppDomainProtocolListenerChannel(String,String,IListenerChannelCallback)

    Starts an application domain protocol listener channel.

    public void StartAppDomainProtocolListenerChannel (string appId, string protocolId, System.Web.Hosting.IListenerChannelCallback listenerChannelCallback);

    Parameters

    • appId
      String

      The application ID.

    • protocolId
      String

      The protocol ID.

    • listenerChannelCallback
      IListenerChannelCallback

      The protocol listener channel callback.

  • StartApplication(String,String,Object)

    Starts the specified application.

    public void StartApplication (string appId, string appPath, out object runtimeInterface);

    Parameters

    • appId
      String

      The application ID.

    • appPath
      String

      The virtual path to the application.

    • runtimeInterface
      Object

      A runtime manager interface.

  • StartProcessProtocolListenerChannel(String,IListenerChannelCallback)

    Starts a process protocol listener channel.

    public void StartProcessProtocolListenerChannel (string protocolId, System.Web.Hosting.IListenerChannelCallback listenerChannelCallback);

    Parameters

    • protocolId
      String

      The protocol ID.

    • listenerChannelCallback
      IListenerChannelCallback

      The protocol listener channel callback.

  • StopAppDomainProtocol(String,String,Boolean)

    Stops an application domain protocol listener channel.

    public void StopAppDomainProtocol (string appId, string protocolId, bool immediate);

    Parameters

    • appId
      String

      The application ID.

    • protocolId
      String

      The protocol ID.

    • immediate
      Boolean

      Whether to stop the protocol immediately.

    Remarks

    StopAppDomainProtocol is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

  • StopAppDomainProtocolListenerChannel(String,String,Int32,Boolean)

    Stops an application domain protocol listener channel.

    public void StopAppDomainProtocolListenerChannel (string appId, string protocolId, int listenerChannelId, bool immediate);

    Parameters

    • appId
      String

      The application ID

    • protocolId
      String

      The protocol ID.

    • listenerChannelId
      Int32

      The protocol listener channel ID.

    • immediate
      Boolean

      Whether to stop the protocol listener channel immediately.

  • StopProcessProtocol(String,Boolean)

    Stops a process protocol.

    public void StopProcessProtocol (string protocolId, bool immediate);

    Parameters

    • protocolId
      String

      The protocol ID.

    • immediate
      Boolean

      Whether to stop the protocol immediately.

    Remarks

    StopProcessProtocol is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

  • StopProcessProtocolListenerChannel(String,Int32,Boolean)

    Stops a protocol listener channel.

    public void StopProcessProtocolListenerChannel (string protocolId, int listenerChannelId, bool immediate);

    Parameters

    • protocolId
      String

      The protocol ID.

    • listenerChannelId
      Int32

      The protocol listener channel callback.

    • immediate
      Boolean

      Whether to stop the protocol listener channel immediately.
